content.author: Gilbert Keith Chesterton
content.quote: You can only find truth with logic if you have already found truth without it.

content.author: Jimmy Durante
content.quote: Be nice to people on your way up because you meet them on your way down.

content.author: Frank Lloyd Wright
content.quote: I'm all in favor of keeping dangerous weapons out of the hands of fools. Let's start with typewriters.

content.author: Ian L. Fleming
content.quote: I shall not waste my days in trying to prolong them.

content.author: Saint Augustine
content.quote: Give me chastity and continence, but not yet.

content.author: Sherlock Holmes
content.quote: Once you eliminate the impossible, whatever remains, no matter how improbable, must be the truth.

content.author: George Bernard Shaw
content.quote: If you can't get rid of the skeleton in your closet, you'd best teach it to dance.

content.author: Frank Lloyd Wright
content.quote: Many wealthy people are little more than janitors of their possessions.

content.author: Groucho Marx
content.quote: I've had a wonderful time, but this wasn't it.
